rules: Rule1: Provided that sample 1 needs lab analysis, site A has a geological sample.
Rule2: Either sample 1 needs lab analysis or sample 1 has field analysis.
Rule3: Whenever sample 1 has field analysis, the survey can proceed at site A.
Rule4: Either monitoring is active in region B or region B has seismic sensors.
Rule5: Under the condition that region B has seismic sensors, region B does not have volcanic activity.
Rule6: If an alert was issued for region B, then region B needs evacuation.
Rule7: Given that project X has a primary team, either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.
Rule8: Under the condition that project X has a secondary team, either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.
Rule9: If Team Alpha is available, then project X has a primary team.
Rule10: Either Team Alpha is available or Team Beta is available.
Rule11: Provided that Team Beta is available, project X has a secondary team.
Rule12: If site A requires a permit, then site A has environmental clearance.
Rule13: If site A is inspected, then failure of the conditional that site A has environmental clearance implies site A is surveyed results in site A having a violation.
Rule14: Provided that equipment data is consistent, it is not the case that equipment data is verified.
Rule15: Provided that site A has pending approval, site A requires a permit.
Rule16: Either site A has pending approval, or if Team Alpha has valid equipment, then either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.
Rule17: If the report from Team Alpha is approved, then whenever equipment data is consistent, equipment data is verified.
Rule18: Provided that the report from Team Alpha is complete, the report from Team Alpha is approved.

Rule19: If project X passed the audit, then failure of the conditional that Team Alpha submitted a report implies the report from Team Alpha is complete results in the report from Team Alpha not needing correction.
Rule20: Whenever equipment data requires review, equipment data is consistent.
Rule21: Either Team Alpha has backup equipment or equipment data does not require review.
Rule22: Project X has sufficient funding or project X has an external grant.
Rule23: Provided that project X has an external grant, if site A has pending approval, then site A is surveyed.
Rule24: If the survey can proceed at site A, then whenever project X has sufficient funding, the condition that site A has pending approval implies site A is surveyed.
Rule25: Failure of the conditional that monitoring is active in region B implies region B does not have volcanic activity results in an alert being issued for region B.
Rule26: Failure of the conditional that monitoring is active in region B implies region B does not have volcanic activity results in region B not needing evacuation.
Rule27: Failure of the conditional that site A has environmental clearance implies site A is surveyed results in site A not having a violation.
Rule28: Failure of the conditional that Team Alpha submitted a report implies the report from Team Alpha is complete results in the report from Team Alpha needing correction.
Rule29: Failure of the conditional that site A has pending approval implies site A is surveyed results in equipment data requiring review.

Rule30: Failure of the conditional that failure of the conditional that Team Alpha has valid equipment implies either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B results in site A having a safety issue results in region B having volcanic activity.
Rule31: Under the condition that project X did not pass the audit, project X has a funding cut.
Rule32: Provided that project X did not pass the audit, project X does not have a funding cut.
facts: Fact1: Team Alpha has valid equipment.
Fact3: Team Alpha submitted a report.
Fact4: Site A does not have stable ground.
Fact5: Site A does not have a geological sample.
Fact6: Site A does not have a safety issue.
Fact7: Site A is not surveyed.
Fact8: Team Alpha does not have backup equipment.

question: There is an alternative site B.
